MRN-8_syn_1:
Indication: Malignant obstruction + Effusion.
Proc: Rigid Bronch, RMS Stent, PleurX.
Details: Debulked RMS tumor. Placed metallic stent. Extensive suction. Pericardial window (CT Surgery). PleurX placed right.
Plan: Oncology.
MRN-8_syn_2:
PROCEDURE: Combined Hybrid Airway and Pleural Intervention.
NARRATIVE: Rigid bronchoscopy addressed the right mainstem tumor. Debulking and dilation facilitated the placement of a metallic stent. Post-obstructive secretions were cleared. Concurrently, a pericardial window was performed by the surgical team (separate note). Finally, a tunneled indwelling pleural catheter (PleurX) was inserted for management of the malignant effusion.
IMPRESSION: Palliation of airway and pleural disease.
MRN-8_syn_3:
Codes: 31636 (Bronchial Stent), 31641 (Tumor Destruction), 32550 (IPC).
Note: 31631 is tracheal; RMS is bronchial (31636). Debulking charged separately.
Procedures: Rigid bronch + Stent + IPC.
MRN-8_syn_4:
Procedure: Hybrid Case
Patient: [REDACTED]
Steps:
1. Rigid scope.
2. Cleaned out RMS tumor.
3. Put metal stent in RMS.
4. Cleaned out pus.
5. Surgery did their window.
6. I put in a PleurX drain.
Plan: Chemo.
MRN-8_syn_5: Big case in the hybrid room. Rigid bronch first. scraped out the tumor in the right main. put a metal stent in. sucked out a ton of junk. surgeons did the heart window. then i put a tunnelled catheter in the chest for the fluid. patient stable.
MRN-8_syn_6: Complex hybrid-OR case. Procedures: Rigid bronchoscopy for right mainstem tumor debulking, balloon dilation, metallic stent placement. Extensive suctioning of post-obstructive secretions. Right PleurX catheter placement. Pericardial window by CT surgery (separate report).
MRN-8_syn_7:
[Indication]
RMS obstruction, malignant effusion.
[Anesthesia]
General.
[Description]
Rigid bronch: Tumor debulked, RMS stent placed. IPC: Right PleurX placed.
[Plan]
Discharge planning.
MRN-8_syn_8: In a combined procedure in the operating room, we addressed both the patient's airway and fluid issues. Using a rigid scope, we cleared a tumor blocking the right main airway and placed a metal stent to keep it open. We also suctioned out a lot of trapped secretions. After the surgeons finished their part, we placed a permanent PleurX drain for the fluid around the lung.
MRN-8_syn_9:
Procedure: Multi-modal palliative intervention.
Action: Rigid endoscopic recanalization of the RMS was performed via debulking and stenting. A tunneled pleural drainage system was implanted.
Result: Restoration of airway patency and pleural drainage.
